cluster.upgrade.CheckUpgradeDescription: Check for upgrades on all Hosts (If not, only upgrade Hosts with known upgrades)
cluster.upgrade.CheckUpgradeFieldHelp: If checked, run check_for_upgrade action on all hosts before executing upgrade on them. If unchecked, run upgrade only for hosts with available upgrades and ignore all other hosts
cluster.upgrade.ClusterInMaintenaceMessa: 'The scheduling policy for cluster {clusterName} is currently set to cluster_maintenance.  This typically indicates maintenance is currently in progress.  It is not recommeneded to run the cluster upgrade operation in this situation.
cluster.upgrade.ClusterInMaintenaceTitle: The cluster is currently in maintenance mode!
cluster.upgrade.HostsDescription: Will be upgraded one at a time during Cluster upgrade
cluster.upgrade.LoadingMessage: This may take a few moments.
cluster.upgrade.MigrateDescription: Will be migrated to a new Host before Cluster upgrade
cluster.upgrade.NoHostsMessage: There are no hosts in this cluster. A cluster without hosts cannot be upgraded.
cluster.upgrade.NonMigratableDescription: Will be stopped before Cluster upgrade
cluster.upgrade.OperationFailed: Failed to start the upgrade for {clusterName}.
cluster.upgrade.OperationStarted: Upgrade of cluster {clusterName} is in progress...
cluster.upgrade.RebootAfterFieldHelp: If checked reboot hosts after successful upgrade
cluster.upgrade.SelectHostsMessage: If a host has a down status, it can cause the cluster upgrade to fail.
cluster.upgrade.StopPinnedDescription: Stop Virtual Machines pinned to Hosts.
cluster.upgrade.StopPinnedFieldHelp: Specify whether to stop virtual machines pinned to the host being upgraded. If checked, the pinned non-migratable virtual machines will be stopped and host will be upgraded, otherwise the host will be skipped.
cluster.upgrade.Title: Upgrade Cluster {clusterName}
cluster.upgrade.UpgradeTimeoutFieldHelp: Timeout in minutes to wait for an individual host to be upgraded. The default is 60 minutes (1 hour).
cluster.upgrade.UseMaintenancePolicyDesc: Switch Cluster policy to Cluster Maintenance during upgrade
cluster.upgrade.UseMaintenancePolicyFiel: If checked the cluster's policy will be switched to maintenance during the upgrade. If not checked the policy will be unchanged.
cluster.upgrade.TrackProgressInfo: The upgrade is running in the background and will continue if this wizard is closed before completion.

cpu.pinning.modal.title: CPU Pinning
cpu.pinning.modal.field.cpupinning.place: No CPU Pinning specified for the VM
cpu.pinning.modal.field.host.runson.plac: The VM is currently not running
cpu.pinning.modal.empty.title: No CPU topology found
cpu.pinning.modal.alert.pinning.title: Invalid pinning
cpu.pinning.modal.alert.pinning.text: The pinning is not valid for the selected host. Some pinned CPU IDs do not map to host CPU IDs.
cpu.pinning.modal.cputopology.descriptio: The CPU Topology shows mapping from the VM's vCPU to the host physical CPU
The CPU Topology shows mapping from the host physical CPU to the VM that has its vCPU pinned to the host physical CPU
dashboard.dataErrorDetail: Could not fetch dashboard data. Please ensure that data warehouse is properly installed and configured.
dashboard.refreshButtonTooltip: Manually refresh dashboard. With default server settings, status card data is updated once a minute and utilization data is updated once every 5 minutes.
dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.utilizationCardDialogEmptyHost: There are currently no utilized hosts
dashboard.utilizationCardDialogEmptyStor: There are currently no utilized storage domains
dashboard.utilizationCardDialogEmptyVmLi: There are currently no utilized virtual machines
dashboard.utilizationCardOverCommit: Virtual resources - Committed: {overcommit, number, :: scale/0.01 . % ,_}, Allocated: {allocated, number, :: scale/0.01 . % ,_}
dashboard.utilizationCardOverCommitToolt: The committed and allocated virtual resources are percentages indicating the running virtual resource compared to actual resources.
export.vm.Title: Export VM
export.vm.dataError: Could not fetch data needed for VM export operation
export.vm.noTemplateOnStorageDomainError: {vmName} is based on a thin template, make sure the template's disks are present on the target storage domain
host.copy.networks.dataError: Could not fetch data needed for VM export operation
host.copy.networks.noAvailableHost: No target hosts for copy networks found!
host.copy.networks.selectHostFieldHelp: 'Select a target host to which the source host networks will be copied. A target host must be in the same cluster and have at least the same number of NICs as the source host. The management network configuration is not copied.
host.copy.networks.selectHostLabel: label for the dropdown used to select migration target host
host.copy.networks.targetHostsInfoLabel: Select a target host to copy network(s) to:
migrate.vm.affinityCheckbox: Migrate all VMs in positive enforcing affinity with selected VMs.
migrate.vm.affinityLabelHelp: VMs that are not listed below may also be migrated. VMs that are grouped by affinity may have log errors because of multiple migration attempts.
migrate.vm.dataError: Could not fetch data needed for VM migrate operation
migrate.vm.noAvailableHost: No available host to migrate VMs to
migrate.vm.selectHostFieldHelp: Select 'Automatically Choose Host' to allow the application to select the best suited Host for these Virtual Machines to migrate to.
migrate.vm.suggestEnablingAffinity: Some of the selected VMs are in positive enforcing affinity with other VMs and therefore cannot be migrated individually. In order to migrate VMs grouped by affinity, enable the option below.
migrate.vm.vmInfoLabel: Select a host to migrate {value, number, ::. } virtual machine(s) to:

storage.domains.connections.title: Manage Storage Connections
storage.domains.connections.domain.maint: Storage Domain is not in Maintenance mode
storage.domains.connections.domain?.main: Connections cannot be attached or detached, cannot edit attached connections
vm.gpu.body.display.switch.label: Secondary display adapter for VNC
vm.gpu.body.description: Select vGPU type and the number of instances that you would like to use with this VM.
vm.gpu.dataError: Could not fetch data needed for Manage vGPU operation
vm.gpu.emptyState.body: There are currently no hosts with vGPUs attached in this cluster.
vm.gpu.emptyState.title: No hosts with vGPUs attached
vm.gpu.table.emptyState.body: No results match the filter criteria. Clear all filters to show results.
vm.gpu.table.emptyState.title: NO result found
vm.gpu.save.data.error: Error while saving VM vGPU data. See console log for details
vm.gpu.warning.missing.mdevs: The current configuration of the VM specifies a MDev Type(s) that are not provided by any host in the cluster ({ mdevs }). If you save the dialog, the existing configuration will be overwritten..
vm.gpu.warningTitle.inconsistent.nodispl: Inconsistent Secondary display adapter for VNC settings
vm.gpu.warning.inconsistent.nodisplay: The current configuration of the VM specifies MDev devices with various configurations of the Secondary display adapter for VNC. The Manage vGPU dialog requires the MDev devices to have the same configurations. If you save the dialog, the existing configuration will be overwritten.
vm.gpu.warning.inconsistent.driver.param: The current configuration of the VM specifies MDev devices with various configurations of the Driver parameters. The Manage vGPU dialog requires the MDev devices to have the same configurations. If you save the dialog, the existing configuration will be overwritten.
vm.gpu.body.selections.cards.label: Selected vGPU Type Instances
vm.gpu.body.search.placeholder: Search for a vGPU type id or host
